headline: Dayforce Stockholders Approve Acquisition by Thoma Bravo
summary: MINNEAPOLIS and TORONTO, Nov. 12, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dayforce, Inc. (“Dayforce” or the “Company”) (NYSE:DAY) (TSX:DAY), a global human capital management (HCM) leader that makes work life better, today announced that its stockholders approved the acquisition of Dayforce by Thoma Bravo at the special meeting of stockholders (the “Special Meeting”), held today. “This is an important milestone in our transaction with Thoma Bravo, and we thank our stockholders for their support,” said David Os

content.title: Dayforce Stockholders Approve Acquisition by Thoma Bravo
content.summary: MINNEAPOLIS and TORONTO, Nov. 12, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dayforce, Inc. (“Dayforce” or the “Company”) (NYSE:DAY) (TSX:DAY), a global human capital management (HCM) leader that makes work life better, today announced that its stockholders approved the acquisition of Dayforce by Thoma Bravo at the special meeting of stockholders (the “Special Meeting”), held today. “This is an important milestone in our transaction with Thoma Bravo, and we thank our stockholders for their support,” said David Os

headline: Dayforce shareholders back Thoma Bravo's $12.3 billion take-private deal
summary: The preliminary results of a special meeting held on Wednesday showed that about 88.4% of votes were in favor ⁠of the Thoma ‌Bravo deal.  The software sector has emerged as an investment target due to resilient subscription ‍services and recurring revenue in an economy weighed down by a deteriorating labor market, trade tariffs and erratic spending.  T. ​Rowe Price Associates, with a 15.7% ‌stake in Dayforce, had in October said it would vote against the transaction, calling the offer "underwhelming" and an attempt to take advantage of "short-term pessimism" in the sector.
